solution_line_template: Over the past five years, the sum of the temperatures was {temp_2020}+{temp_2019}+{temp_2018}+{temp_2017}+{temp_2016}=<<{temp_2020}+{temp_2019}+{temp_2018}+{temp_2017}+{temp_2016}={sum_of_temperatures}>>{sum_of_temperatures}

To find the average temperature you divide the total temperature ({sum_of_temperatures}) by {number_of_years}, so {sum_of_temperatures}/{number_of_years} = <<{sum_of_temperatures}/{number_of_years}={average_temperature}>>{average_temperature} degrees
